column1: senya or senwa in Quenya means "usual".
The etymology of senya/senwa is unknown. Patrick H. Wynne has suggested that it contains the verbal stem sen "let loose
senya also appears in the chapter The Disaster of the Gladden Fields
column2: although unglossed. It has been suggested that it could mean "my son"
column3: as it is spoken by Isildur in response to his son Elendur (son of Isildur)s use of the word atarinya
